com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.argument
Class LongArrayArgs

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.argument.LongArrayArgs

public final class LongArrayArgs
extends Object

Static methods to check long[] and Long[] arguments.

See ObjectArgs for an overview.

Author:
Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)

checkPositive

@FullyTested
public static long[] checkPositive(long[] ref,
                                               String argName)
Tests if all values in an array are positive: greater than zero.

Parameters:
ref - array of values to test. May be empty
argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "valueList"
Returns:
the validated array
Throws:
NullPointerException - if ref is null
IllegalArgumentException - if any value is not positive
See Also:

checkValueInsideRange

@FullyTested
public static long[] checkValueInsideRange(long[] ref,
                                                       long minRangeValue,
                                                       long maxRangeValue,
                                                       String argName)
Tests if all values in an array are within specified range.

Example: All values must be >= 3 and <= 7:
checkValueInsideRange(numbersArray, 3, 7, "numbersArray");

Parameters:
ref - array of values to test. May be empty
minRangeValue - minimum value (inclusive) for inclusive range of each value in array to test
maxRangeValue - maximum value (inclusive) for inclusive range of each value in array to test
argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "valueList"
Returns:
the validated array
Throws:
NullPointerException - if ref is null
IllegalArgumentException -
  • if minValue > maxValue
  • if any value of ref is outside allowed range
See Also:
checkValueInsideRange(Long[], long, long, String), LongIterableArgs.checkValueInsideRange(Iterable, long, long, String)

checkValueInsideRange

checkValueInsideRange(numbersArray, 3, 7, "numbersArray");

checkValueOutsideRange

@FullyTested
public static long[] checkValueOutsideRange(long[] ref,
                                                        long minRangeValue,
                                                        long maxRangeValue,
                                                        String argName)
Tests if all values in an array are not within specified range.

Example: All values must be <= 3 and >= 7:
checkValueInsideRange(numbersArray, 4, 6, "numbersArray");

Parameters:
ref - array of values to test. May be empty
minRangeValue - minimum value (inclusive) for exclusive range of each value in array to test
maxRangeValue - maximum value (inclusive) for exclusive range of each value in array to test
argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "valueList"
Returns:
the validated array
Throws:
NullPointerException - if ref is null
IllegalArgumentException -
  • if minValue > maxValue
  • if any value of ref is inside not-allowed range
See Also:
checkValueOutsideRange(Long[], long, long, String), LongIterableArgs.checkValueOutsideRange(Iterable, long, long, String)

checkExactValue

@FullyTested
public static long[] checkExactValue(long[] ref,
                                                 long exactValue,
                                                 String argName)
Tests if all values in an array have an exact value.

Parameters:
ref - array of values to test. May be empty
exactValue - expected value
argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "valueList"
Returns:
the validated array
Throws:
NullPointerException - if ref is null
IllegalArgumentException - if any value of ref is not exactValue
See Also:
checkExactValue(Long[], long, String), LongIterableArgs.checkExactValue(Iterable, long, String)
